org.apache.commons.dbcp2.managed

Class PoolableManagedConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.commons.dbcp2.AbandonedTrace
      • org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingConnection<Connection>
        • org.apache.commons.dbcp2.PoolableConnection
          • org.apache.commons.dbcp2.managed.PoolableManagedConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Connection, Wrapper, PoolableConnectionMXBean, TrackedUse

    public class PoolableManagedConnection
extends PoolableConnection
    PoolableConnection that unregisters from TransactionRegistry on Connection real destroy.
    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    PoolableConnection

      • PoolableManagedConnection

        public PoolableManagedConnection(TransactionRegistry transactionRegistry,
                                 Connection conn,
                                 ObjectPool<PoolableConnection> pool,
                                 Collection<String> disconnectSqlCodes,
                                 boolean fastFailValidation)
        Create a PoolableManagedConnection.
        Parameters:
        transactionRegistry - transaction registry
        conn - underlying connection
        pool - connection pool
        disconnectSqlCodes - SQL_STATE codes considered fatal disconnection errors
        fastFailValidation - true means fatal disconnection errors cause subsequent validations to fail immediately (no attempt to run query or isValid)
